page.title: 11The Gayton Post Office
page.content: The Post Office in Gayton is the only shop in the village. It is situated in the kitchen of a private house in the High Street. Because it is the only shop it sells greetings cards, wrapping paper and other stationary. It also serves as a community "notice board", informing villagers of local events and services. The postmistress says that during a normal week at least one member of each family will make a visit. 53 Retirement pensions are paid out each week (population 520). 50 pounds worth of postage stamps are sold each week. The most popular stamp is the 17p first class letter stamp. One thousand pounds is paid into the post office each week and four thousand pounds is taken out.
